intro: Sphaeralcea choapina, commonly known as the Choapina globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss through transpiration. Sphaeralcea choapina plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is a member of the Malvaceae family.
